txt.en: 'Thanks again, [placeholder]. That creature was a real terror.'
'That creature won't be coming back here, I reckon.'
Garbert has devised a plan for catching the sneaking creature.
'Did you bring my arrows and the carcass?'
Bring the arrows to Wistan

'If we place these fish beneath the open window of my cottage, I reckon we might surprise him when he returns to try for the cradle again. Little will it know that Afanen will have Whelan safely away.\n\n'Let me know when you are ready to go, [placeholder], and we can prepare. I'm no hunter, so I sent word to a friend of mine, a hunter named Adwold, to lend a hand. He'll meet us later.'
Garbert is at his cottage south of Echad Candelleth, at a fork in the river Bruinen.\n\nYou should speak with Garbert when you are ready to carry out his plan to capture the creature.

'Arrows, but no hart? Did I miss?

'Ah! I was beaten to the carcass by a creeping beast. It is the height of humiliation.

'I suppose we should be thankful that the fisherman and his wife were unharmed.'
Wistan is at his camp-fire at Echad Candelleth, the Elf-camp in Tâl Bruinen, north of Garbert's cottage.\n\nGarbert suggested that you bring Wistan's arrows back to him.
'I do not think that creature will be coming back here, [placeholder]. You and Wistan really put the fear in him, and I expect he's already far off.'
Talk to Garbert
'Thank you so much for scaring off that horrible creature! I don't think he'll come back here again, not if he knows what's good for him!'
Talk to Wistan

'I have never seen such a creature! Are you sure it won't return?

'Nevertheless, I shall remain wary, until I am certain myself. You have my thanks, though.

'You should probably take those arrows back to your hunter friend.'
'Are you ready to go? Let us prepare the trap to catch this creature.'\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>This is a Solo quest, and cannot be completed with a Fellowship.</rgb>
Talk to Garbert and carry out his plan to capture the creature
'You did well, [placeholder]. That thing won't be coming back here, I reckon.'
'I'll tell Adwold that Tâl Bruinen is free of that creature... sometime.'

'Arrows, but no hart? Did I miss?

'Ah! I was beaten to the carcass by a creeping beast. It is the height of humiliation.

'I suppose we should be thankful that the fisherman and his wife were unharmed.'
A Trap for the Creature
Garbert is at his cottage south of Echad Candelleth, at a fork in the river Bruinen.\n\nYou should speak with Garbert regarding the creature.
'I'm so pleased you scared that creature away!'
'I'm so relieved for little Whelan. I'll tell him the scary monster is gone!'
